sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 24 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C24, the alternating group A5, or one of the five non-abelian groups of order 24.
message_1: How many non-isomorphic groups of order 24 are there and what are their structures?
message_2:
There are 15 non-isomorphic groups of order 24. Their structures are as follows:

1. Z_24 (cyclic group of order 24)
2. Z_12 × Z_2
3. Z_8 × Z_3
4. Z_6 × Z_4
5. Z_4 × Z_2 × Z_2
6. Z_3 × (Z_2 × Z_2 × Z_2)
7. Z_2 × Z_2 × Z_2 × Z_2 × Z_2 × Z_2 (direct product of six Z_2's)
8. S_3 × Z_4 (semi-direct product of S_3 and Z_4)
9. S_3 × Z_2 × Z_2 (semi-direct product of S_3 and Z_2 × Z_2)
10. S_4 (symmetric group on 4 elements)
11. A_4 × Z_2 (direct product of the alternating group A_4 and Z_2)
12. Q_8 × Z_3 (direct product of the quaternion group Q_8 and Z_3)
13. D_12 (dihedral group of order 12)
14. D_6 × Z_2 (direct product of dihedral group D_6 and Z_2)
15. SL(2,3) (special linear group of 2x2 matrices over the field with 3 elements)

These groups can be found using the Sylow theorems and considering the possible structures of groups of order 24.
